entry.title: Introducing Our New Customer Influence Request Template for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
We‚Äôre pleased to share a refreshed version of our customer request template‚Äînow aligned with SAP's new product operating model. Starting September 29th 2025, you will see this new template in action.

What‚Äôs New?

The new template shifts the focus from feature requests to problem-solving and business outcomes. It‚Äôs designed to help you clearly describe your challenges, propose solutions, and highlight the value of improvements‚Äîso our product teams can respond faster and more effectively.

Why This Matters

This new format helps us:

  • Understand your real-world challenges more clearly
  • Deliver solutions that matter‚Äînot just features
  • Strengthen our collaboration with you to build innovative products with high usage and customer satisfaction

Before You Get Started

  1. A thorough business description from your end is much appreciated.
    This will reduce the need for follow-up questions and minimize back-and-forth communication.
  2. Any request details underpinning your submission are valuable, as they provide us with the overarching context of your business needs.

Here‚Äôs what the new structure looks like:

REQUEST DESCRIPTION

  1. Describe the problem, issue or challenge you are facing within the overall business process.
  2. Propose a solution to address the identified problem, issue or challenge.
  3. Explain how you as a company or the impacted business role will benefit from this improvement.

REQUEST DETAILS

To help us process your request efficiently, please provide the following information:

  • Business Role
  • SAP Fiori App ID 

    ‚ÄãReference: For the SAP Fiori app ID or the business role affected, reference official qualifiers from the SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library.

  • Component Name (application component hierarchy, if you cannot specify an SAP Fiori App ID)
  • Scope Item
  • Attachments: Upload a screenshot or relevant file via the Attachments tab.

SAP BUSINESS SUITE INTEGRATION:
Relevant only if your request covers integration to other public Cloud products

Does this request support the use of SAP Business Suite, consisting of multiple SAP public cloud products*, in a more user friendly, more integrated or more extensible way? If yes, state how.

* Examples include: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, SAP ConcurExpense, SAP Sales Cloud Version 2, etc.

You will see this change applied in most Customer Influence sessions for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. It isn‚Äôt just about formatting; it‚Äôs about making your voice more actionable and impactful in how we build and improve SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. We believe it will make it easier for you to share what matters most‚Äîand for us to act on it.

Thank you for your continuous feedback to improve SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and the SAP Business Suite.

I personally don¬¥t see anything weird here, it¬¥s a perfectly valid custom integration / extension scenario, so it seems you already have a viable custom solution available. üôÇ

Keep in mind that Badge Number can be maintained in Manage User Assignments app, and retrieved via User API at https://api.sap.com/api/sapdme_user/path/getUserUsingGET_1.

I understand that differences in Process vs Discrete workflows can be frustrating. There are clear design reasons for some of them, but others really need and are being harmonized and improved as we go.

If my answer was helpful, please consider accepting it as solution.

Hope it helps, Manoel

entry.title: Re: New FI document type and number range interval in S4HC
entry.content:
Hello @ai_takahashi 

Thank you for your question. Below are the possible solutions to your questions

For the Number-range intervals, you can create any free interval in Define Document Number Ranges and assign it to your custom FI document type in Define Document Types.

The FI document type in Define Document Types. There is no public SAP list of ‚Äúreserved‚Äù interval IDs‚Äîthe rule is simply no overlaps, per company code, and year-dependent if required. SAP Help-Defining Number Range Numbers. SAP Help-Document Types Used in Document Splitting

Regarding the S0/W0, these are document type IDs, not number-range intervals. Some W* types are delivered for country content, for example, Italy‚Äôs FI document types W1‚Ä¶W9 visible in Help; if a given country is not active in your Starter system, you would not see those types and no related intervals. Don‚Äôt reuse delivered country-specific IDs. SAP Help-Document Types Used in Document Splitting

Regarding your question about which IDs to use for custom document types: The FI document type is a two-character key. Use IDs that do not conflict with those already delivered. The safest approach is to stay within the customer namespace Y/Z, as per general SAP guidance, even though document type IDs doesnt technically enforce this. SAP Help Portal-Naming Conventions for Packages

Practical recommendation

In Define Document Number, create a customer block of interval keys 90‚Äì99 for each company code; set the internal/external and year dependencies to suit your policy.

In Define Document Types, create your Y/Z** document type by copying from a similar standard type. Note that some attributes, such as Account types allowed, are not changeable by design in Public Cloud. 3) Assign your interval to the new type in Define Document Types. SAP Support Portal

Why this changed in 2502: SAP clarified how number ranges are assigned to document types (keep the assignment in Define Document Types and maintain ranges in Define Document Number Ranges. SAP Help Portal

Let me know if you need further information. I can send the screen shorts to you if required

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Powering Up Transformation Together: Highlights from the SAP Signavio Community Booth in Austi
entry.content:
The SAP Transformation Excellence Summit in Austin brought together transformation leaders, practitioners, and innovators under one inspiring theme: #PowerUp.

At the SAP Signavio Community booth, we had the chance to meet many of you who stopped by to learn, connect, and explore how our platforms help build business transformation as a repeatable capability. The energy and curiosity we experienced confirmed one thing: transformation is strongest when fueled by community.

 

 

 

 And the journey doesn‚Äôt stop here. Our next SAP Signavio Community Expert Session will take place on October 22: How to Secure Executive Sponsorship for Real Business Value: Lessons from SAP‚Äôs Value Hackathon. üëâ Register here

To keep the conversation going, here are some ways you can engage further:

Business Transformation Group ‚Äì This group is your central hub for everything related to transformation strategy, methodology, and best practices. Join to access thought leadership, learn from experts, and connect with peers shaping the future of business transformation.

SAP Signavio Community ‚Äì Designed for users and practitioners of SAP Signavio, this space offers practical discussions, product updates, and hands-on knowledge sharing. It‚Äôs where you can learn from others‚Äô experiences and discover new ways to get value from your solutions.

SAP LeanIX Community ‚Äì A dedicated space for enterprise architects and modernization leaders. Here, you can exchange ideas on application portfolio management, IT planning, and integration with SAP Signavio to achieve a unified view of transformation.

Business Transformation Network Survey ‚Äì Help us shape the future of our network by sharing your input. Your feedback ensures that the Business Transformation Network evolves in ways that bring the most value to you and your organization.

We are also proud to have the Women-In Process Mining Community on-site, strengthening inclusion and representation in the transformation ecosystem.

Thank you again to everyone who connected with us in Austin. We look forward to continuing the conversation across our communities and upcoming sessions.

#SAPSignavio #PowerUp #SAPTESummit #BusinessTransformation

entry.title: How to use Run_Batch_Job web services call?
entry.content:
Before proceeding, check the documentation below:

  • Using SAP Data Services as a SOAP Web Service provider | SAP Help Portal

Let's use SoapUI as a third-party trigger for our job without the need of exposing the Job directly, but before using the Run_Batch_Job operation, it is important to check if our Session Security is enabled from Data Services Management Console (DSMC).

From DSMC, access the Administrator tab, go to "Web Services" and  "Web Services Configuration".

If Session Security is enabled, you must perform a Logon operation to get a Session ID to provide to the Run_Batch_Job web service call, also perform the Logout to close that session.
Session Security is enabled by default and we will be using it during this post.

On DSMC, let's select "View WSDL" from Web Services Status tab:

It will open a new browser tab, showing the WSDL xml file:

Copy the URL to use on SoapUI. In my case, this is my URL:

  • http://localhost:8080/DataServices/servlet/webservices?ver=2.1&wsdlxml

Since I will be testing from SoapUI installed on the same machine as the web tier application, I will be using localhost, but it would be the SERVER NAME / HOST instead of "localhost".

From SoapUI, right-click on Projects and select "New SOAP Project":

 

Give a name to your project and provide the URL previously collected on DSMC. Click "OK":

It will provide all the Operations available on the WSDL:

We will be using three operations for this test: Logon, Run_Batch_Job and Logout.

Double-click under the request created during the project creation or create a new request, input the CMS information for the connection (same as your CMC login credentials) and execute the Request. 

Check: Logon | SAP Help Portal

You might face an error in case you need to use the cms_system port depending of the application version.
Refer to SAP Note: 3412752 - SAP Data Services Logon web service does not take port in the cms_system parameter.

Logon operation will return a Session ID as previously mentioned in this post:

Now, let's execute a request of Run_Batch_Job.
Check: Run_Batch_Job | SAP Help Portal

I will remove some sections (jobParameters and globalVariables) and the serverGroup parameter, since it does not apply for my test and we will reuse the SessionID from our Logon call:

It successfully ran:

From Data Services Management Console (DSMC) > Administrator > Status / Batch > Training_DS (This is your repository section) > Batch Job Status, you will be able to check the execution history:

After this execution, we will perform a Logout call.
Check: Logout | SAP Help Portal

Note: Tests and screenshots taken from SAP Data Services 2025 version.

Every Web Services call must work outside of SAP Data Services, and in this post, your learned how to applied on SoapUI.
For third party schedulers or tools that could be used to trigger our jobs, you must check with its provider what are the required information to proceed.

üåüIf you have any questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to SAP Support and search under our Knowledge Base!

üìåIf you found this helpful or interesting, I would really appreciate a 'Kudo' to let me know! Your feedback means a lot. üòä

entry.title: Widget is visible in ppt export even when made invisible
entry.content:
Hello SAC experts,

I would like to export a SAC story into PPT in a certain layout, which includes only widget required for the export. This means I would like to remove certain widgets before exporting to PPT.

I have created a button, which makes unwanted widgets invisible:  xxx.setVisible(false). When I export the story in PPT format, it exports all widgets independent on value of this parameter (all widgets are visible). The same behavior is when using the standard PPF export or "Export To PPTX". Unfortunately "Export To PPTX" does not offer the option to chose the widgets as in ExportToPDF. Can you please advice, how to adapt a story into a print version without creating a separate story with the print specific layout?

Thank you.

entry.content:

Errors describes :

In the purchase order, or when entering an invoice, you have entered a G/L account that has been set up in Customizing as not relevant for taxes. When you enter an invoice with reference to a purchase order, you are not permitted to use this type of G/L account, since all invoice items require a tax code.

I checked the Invoice There is no mismatch between the amount . They uses a O1 Tax code which is not in my SAP.

Can anyone help how to solve this issue ?

entry.title: SAP EWM Stock ID missing after GR and before Putaway due to ADHOC movements- how to fix it ?
entry.content:
SAP EWM IBD scenario. IBD GR completed and updated in ECC also.

Later stage instead of completing Put away by creating/using WT for the IBD, users did adhoc HU movement.  users changed batch in HU and did several adhoc movements.  They did several times Pack/Unpack etc with the stock/Hus they received. During these Adhoc transactions stock id got corrupted and it is blank now.

As IBD put away is pending and IBD is not completed, now user want to complete the put away and complete the delivery.  for that they moved stock back to GR Zone, and changed the batch original as per IBD.

As stock ID is corrupted  and original HUs received during GR were deleted, now neither we are able to reverse GR OR complete the Put away. Please advise how to resolve the issue.

From IBD tried to Repack stock into HU , but due stock ID missing not able to proceed further. 

Please advise how to restore stock ID and complete the IBD.

entry.title: Re: Timesheet day validation rules in EC time off
entry.content:
Hi Vikas,

It looks like the rule is checking (IF) the employee is a Kronos user. I assume this is a custom field that is set based on some other criteria - either manually or via another business rule.

Then, it is trying to prevent the user from entering time directly in EC since their time should come from Kronos. 

So, is the 3rd party system that you are trying to post Kronos? Or some other system? If another system, are you getting errors when you post the Kronos time? 

I am not sure there is a way to distinguish which system the time is coming from in the rule, which I assume is attached to a specific Time Recording Profile.

You also mentioned Time Off.  Are you posting Time Off? Or Work Time?

entry.title: Re: SAP EWM: Wave Management (Configuration & Execution)
entry.content:
Hi Arrakis,

Talking with respect to your above question, Wave Management in SAP is an advance concept which is used widely when we have  large number of deliveries to be shipped within a particular deadline.

But, it purely depends on the type of business which you are dealing and there is no such rule that every industry should use "WAVE MANAGEMENT" concept to deliver their products. It depends upon their business requirement. 

As far as I am aware "Wave Management" concept has been introduced to optimize the picking process.

I hope this clarifies your question.

Regards,

Sirisha

entry.title: Re: SAP Inside Track Philadelphia
entry.content:
Manfred:

> get to SAP really early

We are seeing a show in Baltimore the night before, and, being a non-worker, don't get up as early as I once did. In essence, we are commuting to the event from Maryland, probably 100 miles/140 km one-way. We'd drive to a rapid transit park-and-ride stop right after the event, then stay in Center City, and not use the vehicle until we depart. In previous downtown visits we'd take Amtrak from Aberdeen, but NSQ is out there. Partner is not attending, so I'll likely be dropped in the kiss-and-ride lane. üôÇ

I have been contributing to Open Street Maps recently, relying on OSMAND as my navigation app instead of the built-in, or Google, or whatever. And as soon as I looked at a Paoli rail station node URL found it is already outdated. E.g.:

https://www.septa.org/stations/rail/paoli.html

redirects to : https://www.septa.org/stations

Not: https://www.septa.org/stations/paoli-station which is the newer URL.

I've meanwhile been allowed to contribute to Panoramax, adding imagery links to OSM nodes like EV charger stations, transit stations, and particularly the intersection of light rail parking lots with chargers.

Jim

entry.title: S4 HANA - How to process a trade in using sales and distribution with a credit
entry.content:
Requirement:

Customer will discontinue use of 'x' product (not in our SAP system) and buy a new product.

Upon confirmation of the prior product being destroyed by 3rd party, we will sell and ship the new product.

This new sell will reflect a unique and variable discount in the SO and pass through to the invoice.

This discount will be visible on the printed invoice (not aggregated with any other discounts on the order/invoice).

Similar to a Trade In scenario.  We will NOT receive the product back.  We get notified of the destruction which triggers the process.

Ideally - perhaps not a hard requirement - we can use something (document) for visibility that the customer has made this request and that it is pending destruction (for reporting and tracking purposes).

entry.title: The Countdown Is On: Meet the Finalists of the 2025 Partner Innovation Showdown at SAP Connect
entry.content:
What to Expect

This isn‚Äôt your typical breakout session. The Partner Innovation Showdown is a high-energy, fast-paced format where each partner has just seven minutes to pitch their solution. A panel of expert judges will offer live feedback, and you, the audience, will vote in real time to determine the winner.

With the SAP SuccessFactors ecosystem evolving rapidly, this is your chance to see what‚Äôs next‚Äîfrom AI to employee experience to agile workforce solutions‚Äîall in one session.

Meet the 2025 Finalists

We‚Äôre proud to spotlight five partners that represent the best in customer-focused innovation:

  • TalentTeam

  • TechWolf

  • AKT Global

  • HRIZONS

  • TSP ‚Äì The Silicon Partners

entry.title: SAP Business Intelligence - Statement of Direction Update
entry.content:
SAP‚Äôs Eric Fenollosa and Gregory Botticchio recently joined APOS for a web inar to discuss the most recent (July 2025) SAP Business Intelligence Statement of Direction (SOD).

The agenda for the session:

  • SAP BusinessObjects in context
  • SAP BusinessObjects BI maintenance update
  • Web Intelligence 2025 demo

SAP BusinessObjects in Context

Eric began with a discussion of SAP Business Data Cloud and the path towards a Business Data Fabric.

This slide shows the repackaging of components inside the SAP Business Data Cloud, including:

  • SAP Datasphere ‚Äì business semantics
  • SAP Analytics Cloud ‚Äì analytics and planning
  • SAP Business Warehouse ‚Äì BW Private Cloud Edition ‚Äì BW modernization

Once you set up data products in your SAP Business Data Cloud, synchronization is automated within the Business Data Fabric.

The Business Data Fabric journey started in 2023 with SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud powered by SAP HANA Cloud, and enhanced by SAP Databricks and SAP BW. The next step in the evolution of the Business Data Fabric is delivering out-of-the-box always-on data products following a harmonized data model to provide scalable access without duplication to reduce time to value.The Business Data Fabric will continue to adapt to the needs of SAP customers through the addition of more services supporting use cases such as generative AI, data products with rich semantics, and analytical intelligent applications.

Eric then turned to placing SAP BusinessObjects within the context of SAP Business Data Cloud:

SAP BusinessObjects:

  • Is data source agnostic ‚Äì it has native connectivity to all data
  • Covers enterprise reporting use cases
  • Can be deployed on premise or in a private cloud

The timelines announced in the SOD show new versions of SAP BusinessObjects in 2027 and 2029, and mainstream support through 2032.

Links provided in the presentation:

  • SAP standard maintenance strategy
  • SAP Analytics Statement of Direction
  • SAP BusinessObjects BI Maintenance Strategy Document

Eric next reviewed the SAP BusinessObjects portfolio rationalization strategy. SAP has condensed the SAP BusinessObjects offering to focus on maintaining core functionality, as shown in this slide:

One of the critical aspects of this rationalization strategy is the deprecation of the UNV universe. To adopt BI 2025, you must convert your UNV universes to UNX and repoint your Web Intelligence reports to the new UNX universes.

Eric then passed presentation rights to Gregory, who showed us what to expect when we adopt BI 2025. You can watch the full demo on demand here.

Highlights:

  • Data Mode: As requested by many, this mode allows you to preview all of your data and queries, create cubes, and make changes and transformations to the data directly.
  • Dashboarding: New features and augmented interactive control of dashboard display.
  • WIDX Format: Portable, autonomous, and fully operational dashboards.

APOS is hosting a follow-up webinar on Sept. 25, 2025, to answer your questions about how to simplify and accelerate your adoption of BI 2025.

entry.title: Issue and Send Verifiable Credentials
entry.content:
In the evolving landscape of digital ecosystems, verifiable credentials (VCs) have emerged as a powerful tool for establishing trust and enabling secure data sharing. This article outlines the process by which an issuer can create and issue a verifiable credential with SAPs BTP service Decentralized Identity Verification based on a predefined schema, ensuring consistency and authenticity. Following issuance, the credential is securely transferred to the holder, who can use it to participate in a dataspace. For example, within the Catena-X dataspace - a collaborative network enabling trusted data sharing in the automotive and manufacturing sectors - the holder could present their VC to identify themselves in a data sharing use case, ensuring secure and seamless interaction.

Pre-Conditions for Issuance 

Before issuing a verifiable credential, several pre-conditions related to the participating entities, credential configuration, and schema setup must be fulfilled.

  1. A Holder Tenant with an Identity (DID) and Trust List Configuration. The holder, who will receive and own the verifiable credential, must have a valid Decentralized Identifier (DID). This DID uniquely represents the holder within the system, enabling them to securely interact with the issuer and verifiers. Additionally, the issuer‚Äôs DID must be added to the holder‚Äôs trust list. The trust list is critical as it ensures that the holder only accepts verifiable credentials from selected issuers. For example, in Catena-X, this ensures that only accredited organizations acting as trusted credential issuers can issue verifiable credentials to participants.
  2. An Issuer Tenant with an Identity (DID). The issuer, as mentioned earlier, must have a valid DID representing their secure digital identity. This DID is essential for signing and legitimizing the verifiable credentials, allowing other participants in the ecosystem to independently validate their authenticity and trustworthiness. 
  3. A Schema for the Verifiable Credential. The verifiable credential should adhere to a defined schema that specifies its structure and attributes. The schema serves as a standardized blueprint, ensuring that the data within the credential such as names, dates, or unique identifiers is understood and interoperable across all parties in the ecosystem. 
  4. Configure the Issuer: Once the schema is created, the issuer must configure the credential type that they will issue based on that schema. For each credential type the issuer can specify whether the credential requests are processed automatically or manually and if it is tied to its predefined schema. 

Issue Verifiable Credentials

  1. Navigate to credential section and click on the Issue button to start the issuance process.
  2. Configure meta data of the verifiable credential (validity settings and choose signing dentity)


    • Set Expiration: Enter the expiration date and time for the VC (how long the credential will be valid)
    • Revocation List (Optional): If the credential should be revocable, enable the option to assign it to a revocation list and select the appropriate revocation list if more than one exists.
    • Signing Identity: Select the DID (Decentralized Identifier) under your control that will be used to sign the credential. 

  3. Add additional contexts (advanced): Additional contexts allow interoperability with extended schemas or domain-specific vocabularies.

  4. Define credential details


    • Select a credential type supported by your issuer, published via the issuer metadata endpoint. These types can be configured in the issuer settings. Holders may only accept specific credential types from your issuer, so choose accordingly.
    • Select Schema: Choose the schema that defines the structure and required attributes of the credential. The holder‚Äôs wallet will use this schema to validate and display the credential.
    • Fill in Mandatory Attributes: Based on the schema, a dynamic form will be displayed. Enter all required attributes (e.g., name, date of birth, license number). Ensure all fields marked as mandatory are filled; incomplete credentials may be rejected by the holder. Add any additional, non-mandatory attributes as needed.

  5. Finalize verifiable credential:


    • Immediate signing of the verifiable credential or in a later point in time
    • Immediate or deferred offer: Decide if the credential should be offered to the holder immediately after signing or stored for future delivery.

The verifiable credential is now created and can be sent directly to the holder, or, if preferred, stored and delivered upon the holder‚Äôs request at a later time. All issued credentials are visible to the issuer within the wallet, allowing the issuer to select an issued credential in the future for purposes such as revocation or re-offering to the holder.

API

The same process described in the user interface can also be performed programmatically using the API, which provides an endpoint for the combined creation, signing, and offering of credentials in a single call, or, alternatively, allows you to perform these steps individually with separate API calls.

POST {srv}/api/v2.0.0/credentials
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer {token}

{
    "application": "Dataspace",
    "payload": {
      "offer" : {
        "content": {
            "@context": [
                "https://www.w3.org/2018/credentials/v1",
                "https://www.w3.org/2018/credentials/examples/v1"
            ],
            "name": "BPN",
            "description": "BPN",
            "expirationDate": "2025-11-25T16:51:22.000Z",
            "type": [
                "BpnCredential"
            ],
            "issuer": "{issuerDID}",
            "credentialSubject": {
                "id": "{holderDID}",
                "bpn": "BPNL000000002"
            },
            "credentialStatus": {
                "id": "{revocation list}",
                "type": "StatusList2021"
            }            
        }, 
        "signature": {
          "proofMechanism": "external",
          "proofType": "jwt"
        }
      }
    }
}

Next step: 

Read more

  • Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI): A Usage Catalyst for Dataspaces
  • SAP help:  Issuing Verifiable Credentials
  • API documentation in detail

entry.title: Create a new Pricebook Schema using REST API
entry.content:
Is it possible to create a new pricebook (schema) using SOAP or REST API?

If yes, which API and how can it be used to create the Pricebook?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Create a new Pricebook Schema using REST API
entry.content:
Hello,

Yes, it is possible to create a new Pricebook using a rest API. 

Following endpoint might be used:
POST api/v1/admin/Pricebooks/SavePricebookDefinition
For the documentation on this endpoint: https://<CPQ_URL>/webapihelp/index#!/Pricebooks/Pricebooks_SavePricebookDefinition

An example of body for the request would be:
{
"MarketId": ,
"MarketName": "MarketName",
"MarketCode": "MarketCode",
"DistributionChannel": "",
"Id": 0,
"Name": "PricebookName",
"Code": "PricebookCode",
"Description": "",
"AdvancedVisibility": true
}

The response of this payload will be the pricebookID of the newly created pricebook.

entry.title: Introduction to SAP Decentralized Identity Verification (DIV) and Related SSI Blog Posts
entry.content:
SAP Decentralized Identity Verification (DIV) is SAP‚Äôs solution for enabling Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI). With DIV, organizations can establish trusted digital identities, issue and manage verifiable credentials, and empower organizations with secure digital interactions. To help you get started with DIV and explore its full potential, we have published a comprehensive series of blog posts covering setup, configuration, usage, and practical SSI use cases.

Below you will find a categorized list of these blogs for easy navigation:

  1. Setting Up Your SSI Environment
    1. Provisioning SAP‚Äôs Self-Sovereign Identity Wallet: This blog post will guide you through the process of creating a tenant of the DIV using SAP‚Äôs provisioning admin dashboard or API.

  2. Using DIV
    1. Preparing an SSI Wallet for a Holder: In today‚Äôs interconnected digital landscape, secure and decentralized identity management is crucial for seamless and trusted data exchange. To facilitate this, SAP provides DIV, a Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI) wallet solution that enables organizations to participate in SSI use cases.
    2. Creating an SSI Wallet for an Issuer: SAP‚Äôs Decentralized Identity Verification service enables organizations to manage and verify digital identities securely. While the Holder Wallet is primarily used to receive and present verifiable credentials, it can be extended to issue verifiable credentials as well.
    3. Configure the Trust List: A trust configuration is a declarative policy, defining trusted entities (issuers). This configuration typically includes the trusted issuers' decentralized identifiers (DIDs) and optionally a list of credential types.
    4. Issue and Send Verifiable Credentials: This article outlines the process by which an issuer can create and issue a verifiable credential with SAPs BTP service Decentralized Identity Verification based on a predefined schema, ensuring consistency and authenticity.

  3. Use Case Descriptions
    1. Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI): A Usage Catalyst for Data Spaces: A data space is a secure, decentralized framework that enables organizations to share and collaborate on data while keeping control. The exchange of data between companies within a dataspace ecosystem is essential an is securely enabled with the help of DIV.
    2. Using Self-Sovereign Identity and Questionnaire Vouchers for Demand Collection: In the fast-evolving semiconductor industry, understanding market demand is both critical and challenging. Modern data spaces offer new opportunities for more targeted and privacy-preserving demand collection. One innovative approach combines Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI) and verifiable credential (VC) vouchers to streamline questionnaire management within these data spaces.

Explore these resources to learn how SAP DIV can power your journey toward trustworthy, decentralized digital identity and unlock new business value with SSI.

Read more

  • SAP help
  • API documentation

entry.title: ISS - Impossible to Create a "Complementary Products" Product Mix
entry.content:
Hello!

We are experiencing an issue with the Complementary Products feature in our integration between SAP Commerce and the Intelligent Selling Services (ISS).

When creating a new product mix with complementary settings, the system displays an error message: "Failed to train the machine learning model. Check if the catalog is synchronized and if there is enough product views and order data. If the issue persists, contact the system administrator."

Thanks in advance!


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: ISS - Impossible to Create a "Complementary Products"...
entry.content:
Hello there!

As per KBA 3619285 - Data Requirements for Machine Learning in Intelligent Selling services, every type of Recommendations in Intelligent Selling services have their own data requirements for machine learning model be able to work with:

Bellow are the Data requirements for each recommendation:

Trending Products

  • 10 product views or orders
  • Requires corresponding events such as add-to-cart etc.

Related Products

  • 1000 product views‚Äã
  • Requires approximately 10 page views per product.‚Äã

Personalized Products

  • 1000 product views‚Äã
  • Requires approximately 10 page views per product.‚Äã

Complementary Products

  • 50 orders ‚Äã
  • Orders need to be placed by 50 unique users and contain 50 unique products.

Replenishment Products

  • 50 orders ‚Äã
  • Orders need to be placed by 50 users and contain 50 unique products, including repeat-buy transactions done by the same user(s)‚Äã

Recently Viewed Products

  • 1 product view or more.

Kind Regards,
Wesley
SAP Technical Support

entry.title: How to update the Batch in Process and Production Orders via API?
entry.content:
Hello,

I‚Äôm working with OData APIs for order management and need to update the Batch field in orders.
When looking at the ‚ÄúUpdate Process Order‚Äù or ‚ÄúUpdate Production Order‚Äù entities, the batch field is not available.

Is there a way to update the batch on orders using APIs?
Also, is it possible to perform a mass update of the batch across components?

Best regards.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to update the Batch in Process and Production Ord...
entry.content:
Hi,

Yes, it is possible to update the Batch in both Process Orders and Production Orders, but the update must be done on the component level, not on the order header/item entities.

 

Process Orders

For process orders, you can use the entity A_ProcessOrderComponent_2 and perform a PATCH operation.
The following fields can be updated:

  • RequiredQuantity
  • StorageLocation
  • Batch (only for batches with key X ‚Äì Batch Allowed or 2 ‚Äì Batch Single Record)

Mass Update is also possible using the $batch endpoint with multiple change sets. Each component update requires an ETag.

You can see additional information and examples in the following link from SAP Help Portal:

  • Update Process Order

 

Production Orders

For production orders, you must use either A_ProductionOrderComponent_3 or A_ProductionOrderComponent_4, because these entities include the mandatory field ReservationRecordType.

  • A_ProductionOrderComponent_3 allows updates of RequiredQuantity, StorageLocation, and Batch.
  • A_ProductionOrderComponent_4 (RAP BO based) allows a broader set of updates (e.g., Batch, StorageLocation, Material, Plant, BaseUnit, etc.).

You can see additional information and examples in the following link from SAP Help Portal:

  • Update Production Order

Note:

  • Updates are not possible if the order status is DLT, DLFL, TECO, CLSD, or LKD.
  • Each component update requires the ETag in the If-Match header.
  • For mass processing:
           - With A_ProductionOrderComponent_3, you can change components across multiple orders in different change sets.
           - With A_ProductionOrderComponent_4, all updates in one change set must belong to the same order.

Thanks and regards.

entry.title: Change the application title on the detail page of Perform Maintenance Jobs
entry.content:
Through an adaptation project, we've made some changes to the Perform Maintenance Jobs app (F5104A). We gave the adaptation the title "<company> Perform Maintenance Jobs". Now this is what shows up at the top of the page next to our logo. This is good.

But when the user clicks on one of the maintenance jobs in the list, it goes to a page with application title "Perform Maintenance Job". We'd like to change that so it says "<company> Perform Maintenance Job". How would we do that?

I've tried going back to the adaptation project, but there's nothing there to set that detail page title -- as far as I can tell anyway.

I think it may have to do with the technical and business catalogs. There's two entries for F5104A, one for the Maintenance Job, and one for the Maintenance Notification, and their titles match the two we see in the original app. I've tried copying the second one to my TC, and changing the title there, and have the BC reflect this also, but that didn't work. Somehow, I would have to tell our adapted tile to use the adapted target mapping for the Notification.

entry.title: Re: Balancing field Profit center in GL line item 1 not f...
entry.content: The profit center and segment cannot be set manually on the customer and supplier line item

entry.title: Re: SAP Joule for Beginners: Everything You Need to Know - All at one stop!
entry.content: Thanks for the decoding ..

entry.title: Error in post on account for customer Balancing field profit Center GL line Item 1 not filled in the
entry.content:
When we are trying to post the balances for customer account using Clear incoming payments using Post on account option we are unable to post and we are not getting the profitability field to enter.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Error in post on account for customer Balancing field...
entry.content:
It is correct system behavior that error  Balancing field Profit Center in GL line item 1 not filled was issued for the posting to be made.

The profit center and segment cannot be set manually on the customer and supplier line items.

When posting occurs on account debit supplier and credit to Supplier, the system has no where to derive account assignments from.  The same principle applies with debit customer and credit customer or visa versa. 

This logic remains same in both on-premise and public cloud.

See help.sap.com documentation on document splitting  
Document Splitting https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0fa84c9d9c634132b7c4abb9ffdd8f06/4911c9cc2a934a18e1000000...

See 
Examples of Business Transactions Used in Document Splitting
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0fa84c9d9c634132b7c4abb9ffdd8f06/dee14b1a6c264e46b78d22d9...

Supplier Invoice (Business Transaction 0300)
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0fa84c9d9c634132b7c4abb9ffdd8f06/c85faa8e702d422daacc0b6b...
here you will note that on the entry view the supplier line item has no account assignment
it is derived in the general ledger view from the expense and tax line items.

 

Where the system cannot derive an account assignment a fall back mechanism is to use a constant. However not all customers wish to use same as the system will set a fixed value for account assignment customized. You can decide whether to use it based on business requirement.
See Configuration Activity "Edit Constant for Nonassigned Processes" ID 120100.  See configuration help on same. 


I reference below KBAs for your information
2810442 - Substitutions and Document Splitting
As referenced therein: Never use substitution to set an account assignment value in one of the splitting characteristics in case you are expecting any account assignment to be populated from document splitting in that line item.

See also 

3035677 - Sum of base lines equals zero in Document Splitting
As referenced in same "A posting should only contain one business process not multiple. In case two processes are posted in a document. We recommend that you split the document. Enter a separate document for each sub-process." 

 

To create posting with additional line for profit center assignment, For example In app Create Incoming Invoice/Outgoing Invoice  you cannot directly enter a profit center with supplier/customer item, but you can control the profit center derived in the expense/revenue or balance sheet account item. 

Note it is possible to clear customer and vendor open items together 
see also KBA 2841450 - Customer and Vendor - Open items clear together which outlines the conditions and steps for same.

entry.title: Use Hana Graph Engine with Springboot
entry.content:
I'm building a Spring Boot application and considering using the SAP HANA Graph engine as graph database. I'm wondering if there‚Äôs an ORM framework, like Spring Data Neo4j, that supports direct interaction with HANA Graph.

It appears that we can model vertex and edge tables using Spring JPA, but when it comes to GraphScript, we are limited to using stored procedures. That means I have to create the procedure on the HANA instance first and then call it from the service instead of using a native query with Spring JPA for DB interaction.

Is there a more direct way to use GraphScript within SpringBoot without predefining stored procedures in HANA?

entry.title: Re: Top Reasons to Modernize with SAP HANA Cloud ‚Äì Blog #2 in the Series
entry.content: The ability to combine the vector engine, the spatial engine and the SDI/SDA (and/or Datasphere) means I can build conversational AI applications across data residing in @S4HANA (and now in Public Cloud S/4) and @esri ArcGIS Enterprise - and other data sources. This knocks down silos, and enables anyone in the enterprise to ask questions across their enterprise and GIS data. Without middleware or ETL‚Ä¶

entry.title: Re: About Line Item Validation
entry.content:
Hi @ht218 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Data Monitor, Group Reporting & KBA 3372918 - Data Monitor for more details.

To summarise, the help portal references these posting levels because they only exist in ACDOCU and not ACDOCA. Line item validation in the data monitor works on ACDOCU consolidation journal and not ACDOCA.

The validation rules do not trigger because the rules in manage substitution app only apply to ACDOCU records. They work at the time of the manual journal entry posting. The same rules are applied in the data monitor but only against consolidation records. No errors will be raised if your data does not meet the rule conditions in ACDOCU.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Reduction of the net amount when using the gas calculation schema S4hana
entry.content:
When generating a contract in VA41 using the gas calculation scheme, entering the ZPR0 condition (manual value) with a net value of R$273,814,983.00 changes the net value above taxes to R$273,814,359.39.

However, when creating the same scenario using the energy calculation scheme and entering the ZPR0 condition with the same net value of R$273,814,983.00, the net value above taxes remains unchanged.

I need to understand why the gas contract causes this reduction in the net value and, more importantly, how to adjust it to behave like the energy contract.

entry.title: 5 pontos essenciais para o fechamento da fase EXPLORE em projetos SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
entry.content:
A fase EXPLORE da metodologia SAP Activate √© o cora√ß√£o do projeto: √© nela que os processos s√£o validados com base no Fit-to-Standard e que os requisitos de neg√≥cio ganham forma dentro da solu√ß√£o.
Encerrar bem esta etapa √© fundamental para avan√ßar ao REALIZE com confian√ßa, sem lacunas que possam comprometer o desenvolvimento, os testes e, no futuro, o Go-Live.

O Roadmap da metodologia SAP Activate apresenta informa√ß√µes bem completas para apoio nesse momento. Mas caso precise de um guia para refer√™ncia r√°pida, deixo abaixo os 5 pontos chave que devem ser considerados neste momento. Como mais refer√™ncias, deixo ao final deste post o link para o Roadmap completo.

A seguir, compartilho os 5 pontos-chave que devem ser observados no fechamento da fase EXPLORE:

1. Conclus√£o dos Workshops Fit-to-Standard

Todos os workshops planejados devem estar conclu√≠dos, com documenta√ß√£o aprovada e feedback dos Key Users.

  • Processos confirmados e gaps documentados

  • Decis√µes de design registradas

  • Escopo validado junto √†s √°reas de neg√≥cio

Sem isso, corre-se o risco de avan√ßar para o REALIZE com requisitos ainda abertos.

 

2. Backlog de Requisitos Formalizado

Os requisitos adicionais identificados (extens√µes, integra√ß√µes, relat√≥rios, formul√°rios) precisam estar registrados em backlog estruturado.

  • Itens priorizados (MoSCoW ou outro crit√©rio definido)

  • Hist√≥rias de usu√°rio/documenta√ß√£o clara

  • Aprova√ß√£o dos respons√°veis de neg√≥cio

Isso garante visibilidade do que ser√° entregue e do que pode ser postergado.

3. Estrat√©gia de Dados Validada

O plano de dados deve estar claro e acordado entre cliente e integrador.

  • Defini√ß√£o de objetos de dados mestres e transacionais

  • Estrat√©gia de limpeza, extra√ß√£o e carga (ETL)

  • Regras de qualidade e respons√°veis definidos

Avan√ßar sem clareza nesse ponto gera grandes riscos no REALIZE e no Deploy.

4. Plano de Testes Estruturado

Antes de encerrar o EXPLORE, deve haver um plano de testes robusto.

  • Estrat√©gia de testes unit√°rios, integrados e UAT

  • Identifica√ß√£o de cen√°rios de neg√≥cio cr√≠ticos

  • Pap√©is e responsabilidades definidos (quem testa o qu√™)

Assim, os testes no REALIZE fluem com mais organiza√ß√£o e efici√™ncia.

5. Riscos, Decis√µes e Governan√ßa Atualizados

Todos os riscos, depend√™ncias e decis√µes-chave discutidos no EXPLORE precisam estar formalmente registrados.

  • Riscos com planos de mitiga√ß√£o

  • Matriz de decis√µes e impactos documentados

  • Governan√ßa validada para seguir acompanhando no REALIZE

Essa visibilidade fortalece a confian√ßa da lideran√ßa e reduz surpresas adiante.

Conclus√£o

Encerrar bem o EXPLORE significa ter: processos validados, backlog estruturado, dados planejados, testes organizados e governan√ßa atualizada.
Com esses pilares, o projeto entra no REALIZE com solidez, permitindo foco total na constru√ß√£o, testes e prepara√ß√£o para o Go-Live com muito mais previsibilidade e seguran√ßa.

O resultado? Um projeto mais √°gil, sustent√°vel e alinhado ao valor de neg√≥cio esperado com o SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

 

Link para o Roadmap SAP Activate relacionado a esta etapa:

https://me.sap.com/roadmapviewer/group/658F507A-D6F5-4B78-9EE1-0300C5F1E40F/roadmapcontentpage/a11ec6d657054bf9:FA163EAF25B21EEB8FC47DE9E728A8DB

entry.title: Re: GL Accounts Missing in Test and Production for New Co...
entry.content:
Hello @Wayne10 

Thanks for your question and for sharing the screenshot.

Your G/L accounts exist at the chart of accounts level but are not extended to company code XY.

Extend them in Manage G/L Account Master Data using Copy to Company Code or Excel upload, and ensure CBC transport and activation so that both Test and Production environments are updated match.

Refer to the SAP Documentation How to Create Multiple G/L Accounts Using a Spreadsheet (Two-System Landscape) 

This quick demo shows these steps in the app Open this video in a new window 

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Query error when adding a variable [%0]
entry.content:
Hello experts.

I receive an error when using a variable in my query in SAP Business One Hana.


The following query works as expected, but when I change the date ('2025-08-31') in the where clause for a variable ([%0]) it gives an error: 1). [SAP AG][LIBODBCHDB DLL][HDBODBC] Syntax error or access violation;257 sql syntax error: incorrect syntax near "UNION": line 1 col 1 'Job de programaci√≥n back end' (OBSJ) (at pos 1)

SELECT
'RAZONES DE LIQUIDEZ' AS "Raz√≥n financiera",
'' AS "Raz√≥n",
'' AS "Cuenta",
NULL AS "Monto",
'' AS "Cuenta 2",
NULL AS "Monto"
FROM DUMMY

 

UNION ALL

 


SELECT
'Raz√≥n corriente' AS "Raz√≥n financiera",

TO_VARCHAR(
TO_DECIMAL(
SUM(
CASE
WHEN T1."FatherNum" IN ('101','102','103','104','105','106','107','108','109')
THEN T0."Debit" - T0."Credit"
ELSE 0
END
)
/
NULLIF(
SUM(
CASE
WHEN T1."FatherNum" IN ('203','204','204-1','204-2','205','207')
THEN T0."Credit" - T0."Debit"
ELSE 0
END
), 0
)
, 18, 4)
) AS "Raz√≥n",

'Activo corriente' AS "Cuenta",
SUM(
CASE
WHEN T1."FatherNum" IN ('101','102','103','104','105','106','107','108','109')
THEN T0."Debit" - T0."Credit"
ELSE 0
END
) AS "Monto",

'Pasivo corriente' AS "Cuenta 2",
SUM(
CASE
WHEN T1."FatherNum" IN ('203','204','204-1','204-2','205','207')
THEN T0."Credit" - T0."Debit"
ELSE 0
END
) AS "Monto"

FROM "JDT1" T0
INNER JOIN "OACT" T1 ON T0."Account" = T1."AcctCode"
WHERE
T0."RefDate" >= '2020-01-01'
AND T0."RefDate" <= '2025-08-31'

I need to use a variable [0%] instead of  the date  '2025-08-31'

When I try using the variable without the select from dummy query at the beginning, it works

I tried many ways with IA, but still can't make it work.
Thanks in advance.
